#Text=UN releases first-ever human rights report on Kashmir
#Text=Sunday , June 17 , 2018

#Text=On Thursday , the United Nations ( UN ) released its first-ever report for Kashmir , highlighting several incidents of alleged human rights violations in the last two years in the Indian state of Jammu and Kashmir as well as Pakistani -administered areas of Kashmir , namely Gilgit-Baltistan and Azad Kashmir .

#Text=The Indian Ministry of External Affairs ( MEA ) denounced the 49-page report by the UN Office of the High Commissioner for Human Rights , calling it " selective " , " malicious " and " fallacious " .

#Text=The report mentions human rights violations including torture , enforced disappearances , sexual violations , administrative detention , violations on the right to health and education , lack of access to justice and arbitrary arrests and detention among others .

#Text=Zeid Ra'ad Al Hussein , the UN High Commissioner for Human Rights , said he would urge the UN Human Rights Council " to consider establishing a Commission of Inquiry to conduct a comprehensive independent international investigation into allegations of human rights violation in Kashmir " .

column1: #Text=Hussein was not granted permission , by either India or Pakistan , to visit Kashmir for the report .
#Text=Per the report , Pakistan was asked to stop " misuse of anti-terror legislation to persecute those engaging in peaceful political and civil activities and those who express dissent . "
#Text=In July 2016 , Indian security forces killed the Hizbul Mujahideen leader Burhan Muzaffar Wani , which led to protests in the Kashmir Valley .
#Text=In response to the protests , Indian security forces fired metallic pellets , and their activities led to human rights violation , the UN report read .
#Text=It also accused India of the unlawful killing of about 145 civilians since 2016 .
#Text=The report asked India to " fully respect the right of self-determination of the people of Kashmir as protected under international law . "
#Text=The MEA issued a statement which read : " India rejects the report .

#Text=Per the constitution of Jammu and Kashmir it  is and shall be an integral part of the Union of India "

column1: #Text=while Pakistan 's constitution does not mention Azad Kashmir or Gilgit-Baltistan in its territories , but has a provision for relations with Pakistan subject to Jammu and Kashmir people 's decision to acceede to Pakistan .

#Text=The MEA added in their statement , " Cross-border terror and incitement are aimed at suppressing the will of the people of Jammu & Kashmir , disrupting its political and social fabric and undermining India 's integrity " .
#Text=Unlike India , the report was welcomed by Pakistan .

#Text=In a press release , the Foreign Office said Pakistan " welcomes the proposal by the UN High Commissioner for Human Rights to establish a Commission of Inquiry for [ an ] international investigation into human rights violations " in Indian-held Kashmir .

column1: #Text=Directing towards Indian authorities , the report asked to " urgently repeal the Armed Forces ( Jammu and Kashmir ) Special Powers Act , 1990 ; and , in the meantime , immediately remove the requirement for prior central government permission to prosecute security forces personnel accused of human rights violations in civilian courts " .
#Text=" The report violates India 's sovereignty and territorial integrity .

#Text=Kashmiri leader Mirwaiz Umar Farooq wrote on Twitter ,  People of Kashmir thank the U.N. , especially the bold efforts of its HR commissioner , Zeid Ra'ad Al Hussein , for its support to the right of self-determination . "

column1: #Text=The Kashmir-conflict between India and Pakistan has led to two wars since their independence in 1947 .
#Text=Between 1990 and 2017 , there have been about 69,820 militancy-related incidents in Jammu and Kashmir , and more than 41 thousand people were killed .
#Text=In 2017 , there were over 800 ceasefire violations along the heavily-militarised Line of Control in Kashmir between India and Pakistan .
